Articles.Content:
Soory I've been so inactive lately, I've been busy IRL. I'll continue my battle and post so e new ships tonight.

Don't worry I have a lot of stuffs to do IRL too

Probably I'll be busy till next thursday so you can take your time
Would anyone like a little battle? I'm new here so i'll probably lose but i'd like to see how it all works.

I have a few questions, 1, How many missiles may i fire per turn?

2, Can i reload after my turn (i dont mean terminate my craft and launch a new one i mean bring up a few more missiles and dock them to my craft)

3, can i hyperedit to the battleground? I can't get any of my ships to orbit without hacking the gravity or using hyperedit.

I have a few questions, 1, How many missiles may i fire per turn?

2, Can i reload after my turn (i dont mean terminate my craft and launch a new one i mean bring up a few more missiles and dock them to my craft)

3, can i hyperedit to the battleground? I can't get any of my ships to orbit without hacking the gravity or using hyperedit.

1: All of them!

2: Once the battle starts, you are not allowed to spawn new craft or weapons. Use only what you have.

3: Hyper Edit is recommended.

1: All of them!

2: Once the battle starts, you are not allowed to spawn new craft or weapons. Use only what you have.

3: Hyper Edit is recommended.

Am i allowed to keep extra missiles nearby to reload onto my ships?

Also, thanks for the reply.

Am i allowed to keep extra missiles nearby to reload onto my ships?

Also, thanks for the reply.

There would be no advantage to doing that instead of just having them be on the ship in the first place, since you have a limit to how many ships you can have and how much mass you can have.

I just update my alternate carrier rules blog.

*took away rule that fighters couldn't reload

*added rule - one carrier per team

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/1429-War-Eagle-1-s-Alternative-Carrier-Rules-for-Gentlemen-s-Battle-Club

I just update my alternate carrier rules blog.

*took away rule that fighters couldn't reload

*added rule - one carrier per team

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/1429-War-Eagle-1-s-Alternative-Carrier-Rules-for-Gentlemen-s-Battle-Club

There are official carrier rules. We don't need this. lol

There are official carrier rules. We don't need this. lol

I know but as stated i came up with to try to get carriers more into it

I plain to test these rules out later against myself to see if I really like them. If not, back to the drawing board (aka my shower where I do most of my daydreaming and philosophical thinking)

daemon, are you ever going to take your turn?

And can We count the battle between me and Rasheed a win, he hasn't even posted here in like a week.

daemon, are you ever going to take your turn?

And can We count the battle between me and Rasheed a win, he hasn't even posted here in like a week.

Can you post the persist again?

Can you post the persist again?

Here you go:

@Daemon, Augsburg went and recovered 2 of Inger's missiles, and shot three at Spellstopper, knocking out both rear engines, and main gun. The Lamar and Augsburg then retreated to a slightly higher orbit, in the hopes they can outrange the battle-cruisers.

PERSIST! https://www./?skbgvzalk3ypkbh

-Thunder Child attacks Kaiser Friedrich III-

The main cannon fired repeatedly, but most of the shots seemed to phase right through without doing any damage. Only about half of them hit, but they seemed to do nothing.

Seeing that the main cannon was useless, Thunder Child turned her broadside parallel to the Kaiser's. She unloaded a full salvo of six LRMs into the hull of the enemy ship, making lots of flashy explosions and dislodging a drop tank.

Over all, this turn was a failure, but as you can see the Trident-class can't be easily out maneuvred.

Persistence

Guys, I'm back! (almost)

I'll post my ships soon when they're ready

Guys, I'm back! (almost)

I'll post my ships soon when they're ready

Glad to hear it
Pretty slow day today huh?

-Thunder Child attacks Kaiser Friedrich III-

The main cannon fired repeatedly, but most of the shots seemed to phase right through without doing any damage. Only about half of them hit, but they seemed to do nothing.

Seeing that the main cannon was useless, Thunder Child turned her broadside parallel to the Kaiser's. She unloaded a full salvo of six LRMs into the hull of the enemy ship, making lots of flashy explosions and dislodging a drop tank.

Over all, this turn was a failure, but as you can see the Trident-class can't be easily out maneuvred.

The cannon works. It's the physics lag from over a thousand parts together that broke it.

Interesting thought?

What if a new weapon was grabbing onto a ship with two claws and the burning it with an engine?

Think thats legal?

(im also just posting just to get other people talking)
Too easy, 3 seperatrons can burn through plates. 9 seperatrons can get to the core and destroy it.
